messages.msgSnippet: Welcome Amy, I think you ll find a lot of like minded People on this list. I think a lot of us are league-y even if not everyone goes to LLL. I am an AP,
messages.messageBody:
Welcome Amy,
I think you'll find a lot of like minded People on this list. I think a lot
of us are "league-y" even if not everyone goes to LLL. I am an AP,
unschooling mother of three girls 7, 4, and 2. We're a very liberal family.
Vegetarians, family bed, extended nursing, mom at home, etc. I look forward
to hearing more from you.
Amy W.
----- Original Message -----
From: CA Nelson <acnelson@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, June 11, 2000 1:39 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] pictures and other stuff- Long

> Accalia, will be a year on Wednesday. Obviously we haven't begun any
> academic studies LOL, but I've become so interested in unschooling that I
> had to jump in and find out more, more, more.
> I've been going to LLL meetings since Accalia was a few months old and
> have met so many good friends there. I'm also contemplating becoming a
> leader, but I'm also wanting to start an AP support group in my area.
> Anyway, sorry if this is way OT, but I was just so happy to hear from
> other "likeminded" parents.
> BTW, I love Mothering Magazine!
>
> --

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] pictures and other stuff- Long
messages.msgSnippet: Amy W.- Oh no! This will make the second list I m on with like-minded people named Amy :). Such a common name, I guess. We aren t vegetarians (but are trying
messages.messageBody:
Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] pictures and other stuff- Long Amy W.-
   Oh no! This will make the second list I'm on with like-minded people named Amy :). Such a common name, I guess. We aren't vegetarians (but are trying to eat healthier), but we do family bed, I stay at home, am planning to let Accalia decide when she wants to stop nursing, use cloth diapers, and are currently deciding to hold off on any more immunizations until we're more fully informed about the risks. I like to think that by us going against the "norm" with some of these parenting issues we're already teaching Accalia to be more open about the possibilities around her. Hopefully this will lead to a great unschooling experience once she's older.

--
Amy Nelson
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
"The hardest to learn was the least complicated." - The Indigo Girls
From: "Amy" <kworthen@...>

Welcome Amy,
I think you'll find a lot of like minded People on this list. I think a lot
of us are "league-y" even if not everyone goes to LLL. I am an AP,
unschooling mother of three girls 7, 4, and 2. We're a very liberal family.
Vegetarians, family bed, extended nursing, mom at home, etc. I look forward
to hearing more from you.
Amy W.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] pictures and other stuff- Long
messages.msgSnippet: Sorry to hop right in when I don t have a clue what this entire discussion has been about, but I just got so excited to hear somebody talk about LLL and AP!
messages.messageBody:
Sorry to hop right in when I don't have a clue what this entire
discussion has been about, but I just got so excited to hear somebody talk
about LLL and AP! I'm Amy, a 23-year-old SAHM in South Dakota. My dd,
Accalia, will be a year on Wednesday. Obviously we haven't begun any
academic studies LOL, but I've become so interested in unschooling that I
had to jump in and find out more, more, more.
I've been going to LLL meetings since Accalia was a few months old and
have met so many good friends there. I'm also contemplating becoming a
leader, but I'm also wanting to start an AP support group in my area.
Anyway, sorry if this is way OT, but I was just so happy to hear from
other "likeminded" parents.
BTW, I love Mothering Magazine!

--
Amy Nelson
Mama to Accalia (6/14/99)
"The hardest to learn was the least complicated." - The Indigo Girls

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] pictures and other stuff- Long
messages.msgSnippet: Kathy, The pictures sound beautiful!  That is what I am looking for.  I will ask at the next LLL meeting.  Great idea! Lorrie, Amy and all:  Way to go, Amy!
messages.messageBody:
Kathy,
The pictures sound beautiful! That is what I am looking for. I will ask at
the next LLL meeting. Great idea!

Lorrie, Amy and all: Way to go, Amy! La Leche league is mother to mother
breastfeeding support, through group meetings and telephone support. I have
been involved in LLL for 3 yrs, 2 kids, 4 moved, & the decision to stay at
home. Almost all of my best friends I have met throught LLL. I have been a
leader for 1 1/2 yrs and learned about attachment parenting through there.
Although, not everyone there (involved in LLL) AP's.

If you have any more questions, I would be happy to answer them. They do
have a great site, though. I don't read anything unless LLL has approved it
for their libraries. It saves me tons of time, weeding out books that don't
mesh with my personal philosphy, plus I get the books from the group and I
get to keep them for a month. If the library is slow, sometime two months.
hee hee hee

You can find a local group by checking out their site or calling
1-800-laleche. BTW, their address and other great websites is in my signature.

Amy, thanks for the website on UU. I went to a church for the first time
today, but did not realize that is what you were talking about until I was
right in the middle of it. So you all went to church with me this
morning.....hee hee hee..... I liked it. Very different. I am going to
check out the site, but I would love to hear your thoughts. I am very open
minded when I hear other express their thoughts or feelings on something, so
feel free.

Well, better run, I just got my little ones down for a nap and it is 3:30
YIKES! I guess short naps for them or we will be up all hours of the night.
I want to work on a scrapbook page while I don't have little hands in the
middle of it.

Chat with you guys later,
Happy Mothering,
Julie
Mommy to Ali and Matthew, Wife to a Great Man, Adam
Please check out a few of my favorite sites:
http://www.mothering.com
http://www.AttachmentParenting.org
http://www.LaLecheLeague.org
http://www.naturalchild.org
"It helps me to remember that people are more important than ideas and that
being kind is more important than being right."
-Peggy O'Mara, Publisher of Mothering Magazine.

BTW, I live in FL.
